meanings.definition: Capable of being maneuvered or controlled easily.
meanings.sent1: The small boat was manoeuvrable in the narrow river.
meanings.sent2: The toy car was so manoeuvrable that even a child could control it effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The cat found the manoeuvrable toy mouse and had a fun time chasing it around the room.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was as manoeuvrable as a chess piece, always thinking several moves ahead.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's body was incredibly manoeuvrable, effortlessly performing complex routines.

meanings.definition: Able to be moved or directed with ease.
meanings.sent1: The lightweight drone was highly manoeuvrable in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The shopping cart was so manoeuvrable that she could navigate it through crowded aisles without any trouble.
meanings.sent3: The robot vacuum cleaner proved to be quite manoeuvrable as it zipped around the house cleaning up crumbs.
meanings.sent4: Her words were as manoeuvrable as a skilled debater, always able to persuade others effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The gymnast's body was incredibly manoeuvrable, bending and twisting with grace and precision.
